TEXT.TITLE: S.KOREA TO BUY MORE COTTON, ESPECIALLY U.S. COTTON
TEXT.BODY: South Korea plans to import about 387,000 tonnes of cotton this year compared to 225,000 tonnes in 1986, trade ministry officials said. More than three quarters of the total, some 290,000 tonnes, will come from the United States. That will be a 93.7 pct increase on 1986 when U.S. Imports totalled 150,000 tonnes, an official said. He said the U.S. Increase is due partly to the competitiveness of American cotton and partly to efforts by Seoul to reduce its trade surplus with Washington. South Korea is the second largest importer of U.S. Cotton after Japan. REUTER
